About

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat.

The Erehwon Arts Foundation is a non-profit organization established in 2012 for the purpose of developing, providing and bringing Philippine culture and art to all sectors of society. It believes in the philosophy that art is essential in the development of the Filipino and the betterment of the members of a community.

With headquarters at the Erehwon Art Center in Quezon City, Philippines, the Foundation operates in three areas of concern: exhibitions, artist residency, and art policy development. All three areas are supported through donations and contributions from private individuals and institutions.

Vision

To promote art within the Philippines as a means of human and social development, and to promote Philippine art overseas as an expression of Filipino creativity and culture and as the Filipinoâ€™s contribution to global cultural exchange and understanding.

Mission

To serve as a center for an active exchange of ideas in art, by encouraging and supporting the interaction between artists of every persuasion and provides a platform for discovering new ideas, and techniques, and technology in expressing creativity in different forms in the visual and performing arts.

Core Values

Freedom
of thought and expression

Respect
for the rights, differences and dignity of others

Accountability
and responsibility

Service
to the community, country and humanity

Excellence
the pursuit of and commitment

Objectives

  1. To support the arts through effective management of financial and technical resources;
  2. To advocate for effective and truly democratic arts policies that will develop and advance the Philippine artworld;
  3. To unite the Filipino artists regardless of origin, affiliation, and ability in order to enhance a forward-thinking and progressive Philippine artworld community;
  4. To develop the artistic ability of Filipinos and foreigners via art residency grants, scholarships, and exhibition grants;
  5. To stimulate qualitative and relevant artmaking in the Philippines and Southeast Asia through educational programs, database collection, documentation and research, and arts scholarship; and
  6. To encourages artists to excel in their respective fields of endeavor through effective arts management, collections, and exchanges.

Core Programs

Arts Policy Council

This body discusses, formulates, and advocates effective governmental and private sectoral policies.

Artist Residency Program

This program invites selected local and foreign artists to stay and work in designated artist spaces.

Arts Exhibition and Performance Spaces Program

This program designs opportunities for artists and curators to explore and provide creative output through the presentation, review, and publication of exhibits, performances, readings, and other artistic projects.

Contact Us

We're glad to hear from you!
